Fermat Mathematics Tools

Utilities

M.PHI

M.PHI = 1.618033988749895

M.SQRT2

M.SQRT2 = 1.4142135623730951

M.setPrecision

M.setPrecision(Number x)

sets the error tolerance of all functions to x.

M.setPrecision()

updates the error tolerance of all functions to the default of 0.000001.

Arithmetic

M.nearlyEquals

M.nearlyEquals(Number a, Number b, optional Number t) : Boolean

checks if two numbers a and b are almost equal. If the tolerance t isn't specified, the default tolerance is used.

M.sign

M.sign(Number x) : (-1 | 0 | 1)

returns the sign of a number x.

M.square

M.square(Number x) : Number

returns the square of a number x.

M.cube

M.cube(Number x) : Number

returns the cube of a number x.

M.bound

M.bound(Number x, Number min, Number max) : Number

returns x, bounded between two limits min and max.

M.between

M.between(Number x, Number min, Number max) : Boolean

checks if x lies on or between the two limits min and max.

M.numberFormat

M.numberFormat(Number x) : String

formats a number x with thousands separators.

M.toOrdinal

M.toOrdinal(Number x) : String

returns the ordinal (1st, 2nd, ...) of a number x.

M.digits

M.digits(Number x) : [Number]

returns an array with the integer decimal digits of x, in reverse order. For example, M.digits(376) = [6, 7, 3].

M.fractionalDigits

M.fractionalDigits(Number x) : [Number]

returns an array with the fractional decimal digits of x. For example, fractionalDigits(3.456) = [4, 5, 6].

M.decimalPlaces

M.decimalPlaces(Number x) : Number

returns the number of fractional decimal digits of x.

NumberTheory

M.gcd

M.gcd(Integer a, Integer b, ...)

finds the greatest common denominator or two or more integers.

M.lcm

M.lcm(Integer a, Integer b, ...)

finds the least common multiple of two or more integers.

M.isPrime

M.isPrime(Integer n)

checks if a positive integer n is prime and returns a Boolean.

M.isOdd

M.isOdd(Integer n)

checks if a positive integer n is odd and returns a Boolean.

M.isEven

M.isEven(Integer n)

checks if a positive integer n is even and returns a Boolean.

M.primeFactorization

M.primeFactorization(Integer n)

returns an Array of all prime factors of a positive integer n, in ascending order. Repeated prime factors are included multiple times.

M.primeFactors

M.primeFactors(Integer n)

returns an Array of all unique prime factors of a positive integer n, in ascending order.

M.listPrimes

M.listPrimes(Integer n)

returns an Array of all prime numbers up to and including the integer n.

Combinatorics

M.factorial

M.factorial(Number n)

M.binomial

M.binomial(Integer n, Integer k)

M.permutations

M.permutations(Array x)

returns an array of all possible permutations of an array x.

M.subsets

M.subsets(Array x, optional Integer l)

returns an array of all possible subsets of an array x. Specifying an integer l as second parameter restricts the output to all subsets of length l.

M.coinFlips

M.coinFlips(Integer n)

returns a string of n coin flips like 'HTTHTHTTHTT'.
